intro: Ditaxis rubricaulis, commonly known as the red-stemmed mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that attaches to the branches of its host trees. It belongs to the family Loranthaceae and is characterized by its smooth, reddish stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are often pollinated by insects. Its berries are typically red or orange and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. It is found in tropical and subtropical regions, often growing in humid forest environments.
